key_questions: What does each part do? // A for loop has three parts: start, condition, increment for (let i = 0; i < 5; i++) { console
Think about it: • What happens if you change the 5 to a 3? • What if you change i++ to i += 2
? • Can you make it count backwards
Think about it: • What happens if you forget the count++ line? • What if you change the condition to count < 7
? • Can you make it count by 2s instead of 1s
Think about it: • Can you add more fruits to the list? • What if you change "fruits" to "colors" and add color names
? • Try adding numbers to the list - what happens
? 🎯 Practice: Create Your Own Loop Challenge: Use what you learned to create a loop that prints your name 3 times, or counts from 10 down to 1, or lists your favorite foods

structured_content.summary: JavaScript Loops: Learn by Doing Learning Goal: By the end of this, you'll understand how JavaScript loops work by modifying and running real code … // Some ideas: // - Print your name 3 times // - Count from 10 down to 1 // - List your favorite foods ▶️ Try Your Code 🧹 Clear Write some code above and click "Try Your Code"
